headline: Physics + CS @ Harvard. Passionate about data, diplomacy, and solving problems using technology.

experience.summary: - Solidified connections with quantum computing clubs from three other universities.- Created series of talks for students to present their summer research.

- Spearheaded the sustainable design strategy for a real estate project worth over $100M by building a data model to predict approximate LEED score increases of 9 green building technologies and materials. Presented the project entirely in Mandarin Chinese.- Served as a panelist for PwC China’s "You Plus" program, sharing consulting internship experience across 4 sessions.

- Performed historical research for Radcliffe Fellow’s project, "In the Shadows of the Bamboo Curtain: Underground Economies across Greater China during the Cold War." - Examined primary and secondary sources from Macao and wrote chapter summaries for three books in Portuguese on the subject.

- Co-wrote a white paper on internet laws and regulations in both the US and China and proposed policy recommendations. - Engaged in weekly dialogues with students at the University of Fudan (China) to compare perspectives and find common understanding.

- Wrote 3 research guides on mental health in Latin America, allegations of crimes against humanity in Venezuela, and the role of NGOs in the international community- Lead and coordinated team of 8 debate directors for HNMUN-LA 2023, a Harvard-sponsored conference held in Panama
- Established partnership with the Language Center at Harvard; joint project secured$11k funding from the Harvard Culture Lab Innovation Fund

My freshman summer, I did research in solid-state physics under the guidance of Harvard Professor Hongkun Park. Among other materials, I worked with 2D transition metal dicholchogenides, creating Van der Waals heterostructures for use in optoelectronic measurements.Park group website: https://hongkunparklab.com/

I volunteer in a civil association dedicated to the promotion of youth leaders in Latin America. - Worked in the organization of 6 Model UN conferences and 3 High-Level encounters with authorities from government, academia, and the United Nations System. - Streamlined internal processes, from database management to automatic email systems. Designed and coded an RCV-based algorithm for selection of outstanding participations in Model UN Conferences organized by GlobalMUNers. - Gave introductory talks about the guiding principles of the United Nations System and Latin America's involvement in its creation.- Translated conferences’ guides and ruling principles to English. Designed publicity and informational materials for social networks.
            

    
    

    
        Show less
- Worked with Peru-based online academy in tutoring 3 Latin American students in Physics and Mathematics. - One of the students tutored won absolute first place in Mesoamerican Physics Competition.

experience.company_name: Centro de Información de las Naciones Unidas para México, Cuba y República Dominicana (CINU México)
experience.summary:
- Led official conference in commemoration of the 75th anniversary of the United Nations (#UN75), co-organized by the Office of the UN Resident Coordinator in Mexico, the United Nations Information Center for Mexico, Cuba and the Dominican Republic, UNFPA Mexico and GlobalMUNers.- Worked with team from the various organizations in the planning and execution of the three-week long event, in which 500+ Latin American students recreated key moments in the Organization’s history, from the San Francisco Conference to the global fight against Covid-19.
            

    
    

    
        Show less

education.college_degree: High School Degree, IB Diploma Program
education.college_activity: Higher Level Courses: Computer Science, Physics, Math, Literature B (Spanish), Standard Level Courses: Business Management, German AB Initio Achieved highest grade in CS, Physics, Business Management, Theory of Knowledge, and the Extended Essay. Graduated with Honorable Mention of Excellence.

certification.certification: 6.00.1x: Introduction to Computer Science and Programming Using Python

courses.name: Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics (graduate level)
Information Theory, Inference, and Learning Algorithms (graduate level)
The Theory of Algorithmic Fairness (graduate level)
Theoretical Linear Algebra and Real Analysis

awards.name: Franklin Ford Award 2024
awards.summary: Awarded to a junior who “shares Franklin Ford’s scholarly interest in academic subjects, strong intellectual ability, and dry wit”

awards.name: 2nd place - MIT Quantum Computing Hackathon 2024
awards.summary: Second place at the annual edition of MIT’s Quantum Computing Hackathon. As part of Quantinuum’s challenge, my team’s project explored the efficiency of variations of the Quantum Phase Estimation algorithm. I performed the mathematical modeling and came up with theoretical error bounds for the quantum algorithms, which were then tested against experimental runs on Quantinuum’s platform, Nexus.

awards.name: 1st Place – Harvard Chinese Poetry Recitation Contest
awards.organization: Department of East Asian Languages and Civilizations, Harvard University
awards.summary: Won first place in the advanced category of the Fourth Chinese Poetry Recitation Contest for my recitation of the poem 《再别康桥》 ("Farewell to Cambridge"), by celebrated poet Xu Zhimo.

awards.name: Culture Lab Innovation Fund Recipient
awards.organization: Harvard Office for Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging
awards.summary: This language exchange project with the Language Center received the Culture Lab Innovation Fund grant of over $11k, meant to foster an inclusive community at Harvard. Link to project: https://edib.harvard.edu/language-exchange

awards.name: Challenge Winner - Microsoft Student Hackathon
awards.summary: "Learning bit by bit" won first place in Microsoft's Student Hackathon. This project consisted of a step-by-step guide that introduces students to introductory topics in Computer Science using .NET. Used Microsoft's Journey framework to create interactive notebooks that keep students engaged.

awards.name: Bronze Medal – International distributed Physics Olympiad (IdPhO 2020)
awards.summary: Represented Mexico at IdPhO 2020. Organized by Moscow Institute for Physics and Technology. https://ipho-unofficial.org/timeline/2020/

awards.name: Winner – Hackathon CdCMx 2020
awards.summary: I developed the mathematical model for winning project at nationwide Hackathon CdCMx Challenge 2020, co-sponsored by the University of Chicago and Fundación México en Harvard. Project titled "Impact of comorbidities in the Covid-19 Epidemic in Mexico." Project made using Python. https://ricardoskewes.github.io/CoviDetectives/index.html

awards.name: Bronze Medal – European Physics Olympiad
awards.summary: Represented Mexico in the European Physics Olympiad.  Won Bronze. https://eupho.ee/eupho-2020-results/

awards.name: Selected "Best New Student Group on Campus"
awards.organization: Federación de Estudiantes – Tecnológico de Monterrey, Campus Santa Fe
awards.summary: Quanta CSF, the science club I founded and presided, won the "Best New Student Group on Campus" award after its first year of activities. Club organized trips to research centers in the Mexico City area and to Tec de Monterrey's International Science Contest, periodically held movie nights to discuss science, organized a science fiction contest alongside writing club "Paper Pen," invited guest speakers on campus, participated in student fairs, published a weekly problem, and more.

awards.name: First Place in Physics – International Science Contest, Tecnológico de Monterrey
awards.summary: Two-exam format. Was awarded first place by jury of university professors for solution of physics problem. Can read more in the link below. https://tec.mx/es/noticias/monterrey/educacion/mentes-brillantes-con-una-misma-pasion-las-ciencias

awards.name: Gold Medal – Mexican Physics Olympiad 2019
awards.organization: Sociedad Mexicana de Física (Mexican Physical Society)

awards.name: Honorable Mention – International Physics Olympiad 2019
awards.summary: Tel Aviv, Israel. Represented Mexico at the International Physics Olympiad.

awards.name: Foreign Language Leader Award
awards.summary: Recognition for Russian-Spanish language exchange extracurricular as part of program in British schools. Participated during my 3-month study in Canterbury, as part of Tec de Monterrey's international programs.

awards.name: Bronze Medal – British Astronomy and Astrophysics Olympiad
Silver Medal – Mexican Physics Olympiad 2018
awards.organization: Sociedad Mexicana de Física (Mexican Physical Society)

awards.name: Gold Medal – Mexican Physics Olympiad 2017
